entry.title: BRAAAM (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the loud low horn sound (featured) that often appears in action film trailers is known as BRAAAM?

entry.title: 100 beerhouses were licensed in Brighton (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that 100 beerhouses were licensed in Brighton (population 40,000) in the first week after the Beerhouse Act 1830 was enacted?

entry.title: Erika Thompson (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that beekeeper Erika Thompson uses her bare hands to scoop up bees?

entry.title: Suze (The Cough Song) (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that when recording what became "Suze (The Cough Song)", Bob Dylan started coughing, then said that the song ended before his coughing started, and asked the producer to fade it out?

entry.title: velatio nuptialis (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that during the time of the Church Fathers, the velatio nuptialis was used by the church to validate the sacrament of marriage and emphasize its importance?

entry.title: Paul Lill (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Estonian minister of war Paul Lill resigned in 1939, citing the unacceptable conditions of the Bases Treaty with the Soviet Union?

entry.title: Vermont ETV (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that in 1979, Vermont ETV received more donations from viewers in Quebec than it did from Vermonters?

entry.title: R319 road (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a local councillor complained that the R319 road in County Mayo had more humps and hollows than a camel's back?
